author: Anna Plummer

review: At first I thought all I can watch is youtube and Netflix (which I don't have).  If you're using your phone or tablet, I suppose this is true, but I wanted to stream shows from my computer.  A friend of mine did some research and we found that as long as I use the Chrome browser (which is the only thing I use anyway) to stream my videos, I can stream it directly to my TV.  For instance, I can watch movies/shows from Amazon by opening up my Chrome browser, installing the "Chromecast" extension, and playing the media.  This can also be done with Netflix, ABC, CBS, Vimeo, Hulu (yes, regular hulu, no need for a hulu plus account), etc.I have not experienced any lag between audio/video/subtitles either.  I can finally watch anime on a big screen!!

author: Keith Anderson

review: Chromecast is a very useful device to own.  I can now pretty much everything I used to on my laptop on my HD TV.  The only reason I have 4 stars is because it still only has limited services that it supports.  I am sure in time that will increase and then the chromecast will be a must have device.  I was thinking of getting the Apple TV.  Thought I would give this a try for the price difference.  Although the Apple TV would enable to seamlessly move between my Apple devices and my TV, I am not disappointed using the Chromecast at all.  Plus it is more portable.  I would recommend this product to others.
